name: Amazon
description: Amazon is the world's largest e-commerce platform offering millions of products across various categories. Users can browse and search for products, read customer reviews, compare prices, and add items to their shopping cart. The platform provides features like Prime membership for fast shipping, wish lists for saving items, order tracking, and easy returns. Customers can also manage their account settings, payment methods, addresses, and view their purchase history.

name: YouTube
description: YouTube is the leading video sharing and streaming platform with billions of videos. Users can watch content ranging from educational tutorials to entertainment, upload their own videos, and build channels. The platform supports subscribing to favorite creators, creating and managing playlists, commenting on videos, and engaging with the community through likes and shares. It also offers features like video quality settings, subtitles, and personalized recommendations based on viewing history.

name: GitHub
description: GitHub is the premier code hosting platform used by millions of developers worldwide for version control and collaboration. Users can create repositories, manage branches, commit code changes, and track project versions using Git. The platform facilitates team collaboration through pull requests, code reviews, issue tracking, and project boards. It also supports CI/CD workflows, security scanning, and documentation hosting through GitHub Pages.

name: Gmail
description: Gmail is Google's email service offering powerful email management and organization tools. Users can compose, send, receive, and organize emails using labels, folders, and advanced search capabilities. The platform includes features like spam filtering, email threading, attachment handling, and integration with Google Calendar and Drive. Users can also set up filters and rules, manage multiple email accounts, create signatures, and use smart compose for faster email writing.

name: Twitter/X
description: Twitter (now X) is a real-time social media platform for sharing short messages and engaging in public conversations. Users can post tweets with text, images, videos, or polls, follow other users to see their updates, and engage through likes, retweets, and replies. The platform supports direct messaging for private conversations, trending topics exploration, hashtag usage, and list creation for organizing followed accounts. Users can also customize their profile, manage privacy settings, and use advanced search features.

name: LinkedIn
description: LinkedIn is the world's largest professional networking platform connecting professionals and businesses. Users can create detailed professional profiles showcasing their work experience, skills, education, and accomplishments. The platform enables job searching with advanced filters, networking with industry professionals, publishing articles, and engaging with professional content. Users can also receive and give recommendations, join professional groups, follow companies, and participate in industry discussions.

name: Reddit
description: Reddit is a massive discussion platform organized into thousands of topic-based communities called subreddits. Users can browse content, post text, links, images, or videos in relevant subreddits, and participate in discussions through comments. The platform uses an upvote/downvote system for content ranking, supports threaded discussions, and offers both public and private communities. Users can customize their feed, save posts, award exceptional content, and use search features to find specific discussions or communities.

name: Spotify
description: Spotify is a popular music streaming service with millions of songs, albums, and podcasts. Users can search for music by artist, song, or album, create and manage custom playlists, and discover new content through personalized recommendations. The platform supports following favorite artists, sharing music with friends, accessing lyrics, and controlling playback quality. Users can also save music for offline listening, use collaborative playlists, explore curated playlists by mood or genre, and listen to podcasts.

name: Expedia
description: Expedia is a comprehensive online travel booking platform for planning and booking trips worldwide. Users can search and compare flights, hotels, rental cars, and vacation packages based on dates, destinations, and preferences. The platform provides detailed information including prices, reviews, photos, and amenities for each option. Users can manage their bookings, view itineraries, access mobile boarding passes, earn rewards points, and receive travel alerts. It also offers features like flexible date searches, bundle deals, and travel insurance options.

name: Facebook
description: Facebook is a social networking platform where users create profiles, connect with friends, and share posts, photos, videos, Stories, Reels, and live streams in a personalized News Feed. It offers Groups, Pages, Events, and Marketplace for community building, broadcasting, event planning, and local buying/selling, with Messenger integrated for private and group chats. Users can react, comment, share, manage privacy settings, and businesses can run targeted ads, manage pages, and access analytics.

name: Yahoo
description: Yahoo is a web portal and online media platform offering personalized news, finance, sports, entertainment, and weather. Users can read articles and watch videos, track markets with real-time quotes, charts, portfolios, and alerts in Yahoo Finance, follow live scores, schedules, standings, and fantasy leagues in Yahoo Sports, access Yahoo Mail for email with contacts and calendar, use the search engine to find web content, and customize a homepage with topics and local weather. Signing in with a Yahoo account enables personalization and syncing across web and mobile apps.

name: Instagram
description: Instagram is a social media platform for sharing photos and videos. Users create profiles, follow others, and post to the feed, Stories, Reels, and Live; they can apply filters/effects, tag people and locations, and engage via likes, comments, saves, and direct messages. Content discovery is driven by Explore, search, and hashtags, while creators and businesses can run ads, set up Shops, access insights/analytics, and use branded content tools. Privacy controls, verification, and safety features help manage account visibility and interactions.

name: ChatGPT
description: ChatGPT is OpenAI’s web app for interacting with an AI assistant. Users can chat to write, brainstorm, and get answers; upload files (documents, spreadsheets, code) for analysis; generate and edit images; and use web browsing for up-to-date information. The app supports multimodal inputs (text, images, voice), conversation management and sharing, and a library of task-specific GPTs. Users can create custom GPTs with instructions and tools, and organizations can use team and enterprise workspaces with admin controls, SSO, and data management features.

name: eBay
description: eBay is a global online marketplace for buying and selling new and used items via auctions and fixed-price listings. Users can search across millions of categories with advanced filters, bid on items, use Buy It Now or Best Offer, track items with watchlists, and view seller ratings and reviews. The platform supports secure checkout and buyer protection, shipping and return workflows, saved searches and alerts, and messaging between buyers and sellers. Sellers get tools for listing management, pricing, promotions, inventory, analytics, and optional storefronts, plus category-specific programs like Authenticity Guarantee for select goods.

name: Walmart
description: Walmart.com is the online storefront for Walmart, offering millions of products across groceries, household essentials, electronics, apparel, and more. Users can search and filter items, view reviews, check local store availability, and choose fulfillment options like shipping, same-day delivery, or curbside pickup. The site supports order tracking, returns, deals and rollbacks, and a third‑party Marketplace. Customers can create an account to manage orders, saved lists, registries, and Walmart+ membership, and access services like pharmacy refills, photo printing, and a store locator.

name: Weather.com
description: Weather.com is The Weather Channel’s website for real-time weather information and forecasting. Users can enter a location to view current conditions, hourly and 10-day forecasts, and receive severe weather alerts. The site features interactive radar and satellite maps, storm and hurricane tracking, air quality and pollen reports, and precipitation/temperature overlays. It also offers weather news and videos, personalization with saved locations, and links to mobile apps.

name: TikTok
description: TikTok is a short-form video platform centered on an algorithmic ‘For You’ feed. Users can watch, create, and edit vertical videos using in-app tools like filters, effects, AR, music/sounds, captions, and templates. It supports interactive formats such as Duet and Stitch, livestreaming, comments, likes, shares, and follows. Discovery is driven by hashtags, trends, and search, with creator profiles, playlists, and analytics. The platform also offers DMs, monetization options (ads, live gifts), and commerce features like TikTok Shop in supported regions.

name: Microsoft 365 (Office)
description: Office.com is the web hub for Microsoft 365, offering browser-based access to Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, OneDrive, Teams, and related apps. Users can create and edit documents online, store files in OneDrive or SharePoint, share with link-based permissions, and collaborate in real time. The home dashboard surfaces recent and recommended files, templates, and quick actions, with unified search across apps. Signed-in users can manage accounts and subscriptions, install desktop apps, and switch between personal and work/school tenants. Many experiences include Copilot AI for writing, analysis, and content creation.

name: USPS (United States Postal Service)
description: USPS.com is the official site for mailing and shipping services in the United States. Users can buy stamps and supplies, create and print shipping labels with Click-N-Ship, calculate postage, and complete customs forms for international shipments. The site offers package tracking, Informed Delivery with daily mail previews and notifications, and tools to schedule pickups or redelivery, hold mail, change address, forward mail, manage PO Boxes, and find USPS locations and ZIP Codes.

name: Netflix
description: Netflix is a subscription-based streaming platform for movies, series, documentaries, and originals. Users can browse curated rows and Top 10 lists, search by title or genre, get personalized recommendations, and save content to My List. Playback supports multiple profiles, kids mode, subtitles and audio options, 4K/HDR on supported devices, autoplay and skip intro. Mobile and TV apps enable streaming across devices, with offline downloads on mobile and robust account and parental controls.

name: Zillow
description: Zillow is a real estate marketplace for buying, selling, and renting homes. Users can search with map-based tools and filters (price, beds, home type), view photos, 3D tours, property details, neighborhood and school info, and price history. The site offers Zestimate home value estimates, comparable sales, and market trends, plus mortgage calculators, rates, and pre-approval. Renters can browse apartments and apply online. Sellers and agents can create and manage listings and connect with buyers. Users can save searches, favorite homes, and receive alerts.

name: ESPN
description: ESPN is a comprehensive sports hub featuring real-time scores, schedules, standings, and stats across major leagues and college sports. The site offers breaking news, in-depth articles, analysis, and game recaps; interactive Gamecasts with play-by-play; team and player pages; and video highlights. Users can stream live and on‑demand content via ESPN+, browse TV listings, and access fantasy games and pick’em. Personalization lets fans follow favorite teams to customize feeds and alerts.

name: Twitch
description: Twitch is a live-streaming platform focused on gaming, esports, and creator-led IRL content. Users browse categories and tags, follow channels, and watch streams with real-time chat, emotes, and channel points; they can create clips and watch past broadcasts and highlights. Creators manage channels with moderation tools, Stream Manager, and interactive extensions, and monetize via subscriptions (including Prime), Bits, and ads. Discoverability features include browse, search, recommendations, and raids that let streamers send viewers to another channel.

name: Microsoft Account (Live.com)
description: Live.com is Microsoft’s web gateway for Microsoft accounts and Outlook on the web. Users can sign in or create a Microsoft account, manage security and privacy settings (including two-factor authentication and account recovery), and access Outlook email, calendar, and contacts. The site also links to OneDrive cloud storage and Office web apps, integrates with Windows and Microsoft 365 services, and supports both personal and work/school accounts.

name: Pinterest
description: Pinterest is a visual discovery and bookmarking platform where users save images, videos, and links as Pins and organize them into Boards. It offers a personalized home feed, powerful search with visual search (Lens), and Idea Pins for multi-page creative posts. Users can follow topics and creators, collaborate on group boards, and shop via product Pins with merchant catalogs and price details. Business accounts get tools for ads, shopping integrations, and analytics.

name: Roblox
description: Roblox is an online platform for creating, sharing, and playing user-generated 3D experiences. Players can browse millions of experiences, join multiplayer games across devices, chat and socialize, customize avatars with items from the catalog, and use Robux for purchases. Creators build and script games with Roblox Studio (Lua), monetize via in-experience purchases and the marketplace, and access analytics and developer tools. The site provides discovery, events, account management, safety features, and parental controls.

name: PayPal
description: PayPal is a global online payments platform for individuals and businesses. Users can link bank accounts/cards, send and receive money, request payments, and manage balances in multiple currencies. It offers checkout for online stores, Pay Later options, buyer and seller protection, invoicing, subscriptions, and mass payouts. Businesses get merchant accounts, fraud prevention, dispute management, and reporting tools. Developers can integrate payments via APIs and SDKs. The service supports withdrawals, refunds, QR payments, donations, and robust security features including two-factor authentication.

name: Microsoft SharePoint
description: Microsoft SharePoint is a collaboration and content management platform in Microsoft 365 for building intranet, team, and communication sites. It provides document libraries and lists, versioning, permissions, metadata, and real-time co-authoring; site pages, news, web parts, hubs, and navigation; enterprise search; and workflow automation via Power Automate. SharePoint integrates with Microsoft Teams, OneDrive, and Office apps, supports external sharing and mobile access, and offers governance, compliance, and extensibility through the SharePoint Framework and APIs.

name: Etsy
description: Etsy is a global marketplace for unique, handmade, vintage, and craft-supply goods. Shoppers can browse curated categories, search with filters, read reviews, favorite items and shops, request custom orders via messaging, and check out with secure payments and tracked shipping. Sellers get tools to create detailed listings with variations, manage inventory and orders, run discounts and ads, access analytics, and communicate with buyers. The platform supports personalization, gift guides, seller ratings, and buyer protection.

name: Chase
description: Chase.com is the consumer and small-business banking portal of JPMorgan Chase. Users can open and manage checking and savings accounts, credit cards, mortgages, auto loans, and investment accounts; view balances and transactions; pay bills; transfer money and send/receive funds via Zelle; set up alerts; and access statements. The site supports online applications for financial products, credit card rewards management (Ultimate Rewards), mobile banking with the Chase app, customer support, and a branch/ATM locator.

name: The Home Depot
description: The Home Depot is an online home improvement retailer where users can shop tools, building materials, appliances, décor, and garden supplies. The site offers detailed product pages with ratings and reviews, robust search and filtering, real-time store inventory, and options like Buy Online, Pick Up In Store, curbside pickup, and home delivery. Users can find local stores, track orders, create and manage lists, and access DIY project guides, how‑to content, calculators, and design tools. Services include professional installation, tool rental, and bulk pricing, with Pro Xtra rewards and business account features for contractors.

name: Zoom
description: Zoom is a unified communications platform for video meetings, webinars, team chat, and cloud telephony. Users can host and join HD video meetings with screen sharing, breakout rooms, polls, whiteboards, live captions, and cloud recordings; run webinars and virtual events; message in channels; make and receive calls with Zoom Phone; and equip conference rooms with Zoom Rooms. It offers cross-platform apps, browser-based joining, calendar and SSO integrations, admin controls, security features, and an app marketplace.

name: Temu
description: Temu is a discount online marketplace offering millions of low-priced products across categories like home, fashion, beauty, and electronics. Users can browse or search with filters, view ratings and reviews, add items to cart or wishlist, and check out with various payment options. The platform features coupons, flash deals, and gamified promotions, provides personalized recommendations, supports order tracking, buyer protection, and easy returns, and runs both on web and a mobile app.

name: Target
description: Target is a major U.S. retailer offering online shopping across categories like home, electronics, clothing, groceries, and beauty. Users can browse and filter products, read reviews, add items to cart or lists, and check store inventory. The site supports multiple fulfillment options including standard shipping, same-day delivery (Shipt), free Order Pickup, and Drive Up curbside. Features include Target Circle rewards and digital offers, weekly deals and ads, price match, gift cards, registries (baby and wedding), store locator, order tracking, easy returns, and account management via web and mobile app.

name: Quora
description: Quora is a question-and-answer platform where people ask questions and get answers from a community of experts and enthusiasts. Users can follow topics, people, and Spaces (curated communities), receive a personalized feed, and use search to find specific questions. Content is organized by upvotes and relevance, with threaded comments and rich-text formatting for answers (including images and links). Features include requesting answers from specific users, bookmarking, notifications, and moderation tools. Quora also offers Quora+ for premium content and creator monetization.

name: Discord
description: Discord is a cross-platform communication platform built around servers with text, voice, and video channels. Users can create or join servers, chat via DMs and group chats, start low-latency voice/video calls, and share screens. Server features include roles and permissions, threads, forum channels, events, and robust moderation tools (e.g., AutoMod). It supports bots and integrations through an app directory, rich media sharing, custom emojis, reactions, and notifications. Nitro offers perks like HD video, larger uploads, and server boosts.

name: Indeed
description: Indeed is a global job search platform that aggregates listings from employers, job boards, and company career pages. Users can search and filter jobs by title, location, salary, experience level, remote options, and more; create a profile; upload a resume; apply directly through Indeed; save jobs; and set email or mobile alerts. The site offers company pages with reviews, ratings, salaries, and interview insights, plus career advice, a resume builder, and salary tools. Employers can post jobs, sponsor listings to increase visibility, manage candidates, screen with assessments, and communicate through Indeed’s hiring tools and ATS integrations.

name: IMDb (Internet Movie Database)
description: IMDb is a comprehensive database for movies, TV shows, and celebrities. Users can browse detailed title pages with cast and crew credits, synopses, trailers, photos, trivia, quotes, release and box office data, and aggregated user ratings. The site offers powerful search and filters, charts like Top 250 and trending titles, showtimes and streaming availability, and account features to rate titles, write reviews, create lists, and manage a watchlist.

name: MSN
description: MSN is Microsoft’s web portal and news aggregator that delivers curated headlines from a wide range of publishers, personalized by location and interests. It features sections for news, weather, sports, entertainment, and finance, offering local forecasts, real-time stock quotes and scores, and trending videos. Users can sign in with a Microsoft account to follow topics, manage interests, and sync preferences across devices, and access Microsoft services like Outlook, OneDrive, and Bing search.

name: Nextdoor
description: Nextdoor is a hyperlocal social network that connects people within their neighborhoods. Users verify their address to join a local feed where they can post updates, ask questions, share recommendations, organize events, report crime and safety issues, and create polls or urgent alerts. The platform includes a marketplace (For Sale & Free) for buying and selling items, direct messaging, and local interest groups. Local businesses can create profiles, collect reviews, share deals, and advertise, while public agencies and nonprofits can broadcast official community alerts.

name: FedEx
description: FedEx’s website provides shipping and logistics services including package tracking, rate and transit-time quotes, and the ability to create shipments, print labels, and schedule pickups. Users can manage deliveries through Delivery Manager, set delivery preferences, request holds at locations, and handle returns. The site offers a location finder, international shipping tools (customs documentation and duties), account and billing management, small-business resources, freight and LTL services, and developer APIs for e-commerce integration.

name: UPS
description: UPS is a global package delivery and logistics platform. The site lets users track shipments, create and pay for shipping labels, get rates and transit times, schedule pickups, and find drop-off locations. Through UPS My Choice, customers can manage delivery preferences, reroute packages, request holds, and receive notifications. Businesses can access freight and international shipping services, customs and brokerage tools, billing and claims management, and developer APIs for shipping and tracking integration.

name: Hulu
description: Hulu is a subscription streaming service offering a large on-demand library of current-season TV, classic series, movies, and Hulu Originals, plus an optional Hulu + Live TV plan with live channels, sports, and news. Users can create multiple profiles, build a My Stuff watchlist, continue watching across devices, get personalized recommendations, and use features like offline downloads (eligible plans), closed captions, and simultaneous streams. Live TV provides a program guide and cloud DVR recording, with add-ons for premium networks and expanded streaming, and the service is available on web, mobile, smart TVs, game consoles, and streaming devices, including bundle options with Disney+ and ESPN+.

name: Apple
description: Apple’s official website for discovering and purchasing Apple products and services. Users can browse detailed product pages for iPhone, Mac, iPad, Apple Watch, and accessories; compare models; customize configurations; and buy with trade‑in, financing, pickup, or delivery options. The site features Apple services (TV+, Music, iCloud, Arcade), the Newsroom and events, and robust support with guides, repairs, Genius Bar appointments, order tracking, and a store locator.

name: Capital One
description: Capital One’s website provides online banking and credit card services for consumers and businesses. Users can open checking and savings accounts, apply for credit cards, auto loans, and refinance options, and manage existing accounts by paying bills, transferring funds, viewing statements, and redeeming rewards. The site offers secure account login, mobile app access, card management tools (alerts, virtual card numbers via Eno, fraud monitoring), credit tracking with CreditWise, branch/ATM locator, and comprehensive customer support.

name: Realtor.com
description: Realtor.com is a real estate marketplace featuring up-to-date MLS listings for homes for sale, rent, and recently sold. Users can search by location or map, apply filters (price, beds, baths, property type, features), and view detailed listing pages with photos, 3D/virtual tours, neighborhood and school information, price history, and market trends. The site offers saved searches, favorites, alerts, mortgage and affordability calculators, home value estimates, and tools to contact agents and schedule tours.

name: Yelp
description: Yelp is a local search and reviews platform for discovering restaurants, shops, and service providers. Users can search by location and category, view business pages with star ratings, written reviews, photos, menus, hours, contact info, and maps, and apply filters like price, open now, and amenities. The site supports reservations and waitlists, delivery/takeout ordering, and requesting quotes for home and local services. Logged-in users can write reviews, upload photos and videos, check in, create collections, and message businesses, while businesses can claim pages to update details and respond to customers.

name: Instructure
description: Instructure is an education technology company best known for Canvas, a cloud-based learning management system for K–12 and higher ed. The site showcases its product suite—Canvas LMS for course creation, assignments, grading, discussions, quizzes; Mastery Connect for standards-based assessment; Elevate for data and analytics; and Impact for user adoption and messaging—plus integrations (LTI/SIS), mobile apps, admin controls, security/compliance, and APIs. Visitors can explore features, request demos, view pricing, and access resources including documentation, community, and support.

name: Citi (Citibank)
description: Citi’s official website for personal, small business, and institutional banking. Users can open checking/savings accounts, apply for credit cards, loans, and mortgages, and sign in to manage balances, transactions, statements, payments, transfers, and bill pay (including Zelle). The site supports rewards redemption, card controls (lock/unlock, alerts, disputes), rate and fee information, calculators and offers, branch/ATM locator, and customer support. It also provides access to the Citi Mobile app and portals for corporate and treasury services.

name: Lowe's
description: Lowe’s is a home improvement retailer where users can browse and buy appliances, tools, building materials, lighting, paint, and garden supplies. The site offers real-time local store inventory, a store locator, online ordering with delivery or curbside/in-store pickup, and scheduling for installation and home services. Customers can track orders, manage accounts and saved lists, view deals and weekly ads, and access project guides and buying advice. Business customers can use Pro services for bulk pricing, jobsite delivery, and dedicated support, with financing options available via Lowe’s credit.

name: Craigslist
description: Craigslist is a local classifieds platform organized by city where users can browse or post listings for housing, jobs, for sale items, services, gigs, and community events. It features keyword search, category filters, sorting by date or price, and optional map and thumbnail views. Listings include text, price, location, photos, and a map pin, with contact handled via anonymized email relay. Accounts let users manage, edit, renew, and delete posts, and community flagging helps moderate content. The site emphasizes a simple, fast interface focused on local transactions.

name: DoorDash
description: DoorDash operates an on-demand delivery platform. It connects customers with local restaurants, grocery stores, convenience stores and retailers — enabling ordering and delivery of food, groceries, and other everyday items. Through its website and mobile app, customers place orders; independent delivery partners ("Dashers") pick up the items from merchants and deliver them to customers. DoorDash also offers services to merchants (online ordering, storefronts, delivery logistics) and supports features like subscription-based benefits (e.g. DashPass), real-time order tracking, and retail-grocery delivery. Headquartered in San Francisco, DoorDash has become the largest third-party food delivery platform in the United States.

name: Duo Security (Cisco Duo)
description: Duo Security is a cloud-based access security platform focused on Zero Trust. It provides multi-factor authentication (MFA) with Duo Push, TOTP, SMS/phone, and hardware tokens; passwordless and phishing-resistant authentication via FIDO2/WebAuthn and passkeys; and single sign-on (SSO) for web and cloud apps. Duo offers adaptive, risk-based policies (geo/IP, device health, networks), device trust and endpoint visibility with Trusted Endpoints and the Device Health app, and secure remote access to VPN, RDP/SSH, and internal apps (including Duo Network Gateway). It features an admin console for user enrollment, granular policy management, reporting and logging, and integrates with thousands of applications via SAML, OIDC, RADIUS, LDAP, and APIs.

name: Xfinity
description: Xfinity is Comcast’s consumer portal for home internet, TV, mobile, and home security services. Users can check availability, compare plans and bundles, order or upgrade services, and buy equipment. Existing customers can sign in to manage their account—pay bills, view usage, manage WiFi with xFi and parental controls, troubleshoot issues, check outages, schedule appointments, and access support. The site also offers Xfinity Stream, a WiFi hotspot finder, and tools for moving or transferring service.

name: T-Mobile
description: T-Mobile’s official site lets users shop phones and accessories, compare and purchase mobile plans (postpaid, prepaid) and Home Internet, check 5G coverage maps, and access device deals with trade-in and financing. Existing customers can sign in to My T-Mobile to manage accounts, pay bills, upgrade devices, add lines, set up AutoPay, and get support via chat or store locator. The site also offers switching tools, bring-your-own-device options, network status information, and business solutions.

name: Bank of America
description: Bank of America’s official site provides online and mobile banking for personal, small business, and wealth management customers. Users can open accounts and apply for credit cards, auto loans, mortgages, and HELOCs; sign in to view balances and transactions; pay bills; transfer funds; and send/receive money with Zelle. The site offers card and reward management, alerts, budgeting tools, rates and calculators, and FICO Score access. It integrates Merrill for investing (brokerage, IRAs, research), includes a branch/ATM locator, and provides customer support via FAQs, secure messaging, appointment scheduling, and a security center for fraud protection. Links to download the mobile app are also available.

name: Okta
description: Okta is a cloud-based identity and access management platform for workforce and customer applications. It provides single sign-on, adaptive multi-factor authentication, passwordless options (Okta Verify, FastPass), and granular access policies across web, mobile, and SaaS apps. Admins use Universal Directory, Lifecycle Management, Workflows, and Identity Governance to provision/deprovision users, sync with AD/LDAP, automate onboarding/offboarding, and enforce least privilege. The Okta Integration Network offers thousands of pre-built app and infrastructure connectors. For developers, Okta’s Customer Identity Cloud (Auth0) delivers OAuth/OpenID Connect, hosted login, social login, and SDKs/APIs to embed authentication and authorization. The platform includes dashboards, logs, reporting, risk signals, and API access management to secure resources at scale.

name: AT&T
description: AT&T’s website lets consumers and businesses shop wireless plans and 5G devices, order home internet (AT&T Fiber and Internet Air), and access promotions and bundles. Users can check coverage and service availability by address, compare plans, estimate trade-in value, upgrade or add lines, and bring their own device/eSIM. MyAT&T account tools enable bill payment, autopay enrollment, usage and data monitoring, plan changes, device unlock requests, and order tracking. The site provides support articles and troubleshooting, live chat, appointment scheduling, and a store locator, with a business section offering enterprise networking, security, and mobility solutions.

name: Canva
description: Canva is a web-based design platform for creating visuals like social media posts, presentations, videos, documents, and websites. It features a drag-and-drop editor, thousands of customizable templates, and a built-in library of photos, graphics, fonts, and music. Users can collaborate in real time, manage brand assets with Brand Kits, and leverage AI tools (e.g., Magic Design, Magic Write, background remover, Magic Edit) to speed up creation. Canva supports exporting in multiple formats, resizing designs for different platforms, scheduling social posts, and offers printing services and integrations with popular apps.

name: Fidelity Investments
description: Fidelity Investments is a comprehensive financial services platform for investing, retirement, and cash management. Users can open brokerage, IRA, and employer retirement accounts; trade stocks, ETFs, options, and mutual funds; and access research, screeners, real-time quotes, and portfolio analysis tools. The site offers planning calculators, robo-advisory (Fidelity Go), 529 college savings, rollovers and transfers, cash management features, and secure account management via web and mobile, including statements, alerts, and customer support.

name: Shop (by Shopify)
description: Shop is a shopping companion and checkout service from Shopify. Users can browse and follow stores, get a personalized product feed, purchase directly with Shop Pay’s fast checkout and Installments, track packages and delivery updates across many merchants, manage order history and saved payment/address details, and earn/redeem Shop Cash rewards. Merchants can surface products to new customers and benefit from Shop Pay’s optimized conversion.

name: Peacock
description: Peacock is NBCUniversal’s streaming service offering on‑demand TV shows, movies, Peacock Originals, and live programming including sports, news, and curated 24/7 channels. Users can browse and search the catalog, create watchlists and profiles (including kid-friendly options), and resume playback across devices. Subscription tiers include ad-supported Peacock Premium and ad-free Premium Plus, with select titles available for offline downloads and access to live events like Premier League and WWE.

name: Wells Fargo
description: Wells Fargo’s official site for consumer and business banking. Users can open and manage checking and savings accounts, credit cards, mortgages, auto loans, and investment products; use online banking to view balances, pay bills, transfer money (including Zelle), set alerts, and download statements; access budgeting and credit score tools; find branches/ATMs and get customer support; and explore small-business, commercial, and wealth management services. Secure sign-in, fraud protection resources, and mobile app integration are provided.

name: Redfin
description: Redfin is a real estate search and brokerage platform for buying and selling homes across the U.S. and Canada. It offers map-based home search with advanced filters (price, beds, home type, keywords), draw-your-area tools, school and neighborhood data, price history, tax records, and the Redfin Estimate for home values. Users can view photos, 3D walkthroughs and virtual tours, save searches and favorites, set email or push alerts, and calculate mortgage payments. The site lets buyers schedule in-person or virtual tours, request info, and connect with Redfin or partner agents, while sellers can get a home valuation, list with Redfin, and manage the selling process. Redfin also provides market insights, open house information, and mobile apps for on-the-go browsing.

name: Best Buy
description: Best Buy is a major electronics and appliance retailer. Its website offers extensive product search and filtering, detailed specs, ratings and reviews, and comparison tools. Users can check real-time store and delivery availability, choose shipping, same-day delivery, or free store pickup, and track orders. The site supports account management, wishlists, financing and memberships, gift cards, and price match details. It also enables scheduling Geek Squad services (setup, repairs, protection plans), device trade-ins, browsing deals and open-box/clearance items, and finding nearby stores.

name: Costco
description: Costco is a membership-based warehouse retailer’s site for browsing and purchasing a wide range of products, including groceries, electronics, appliances, furniture, and household goods. Members can shop online with two-day delivery and same-day grocery delivery in eligible areas, view warehouse availability, track orders, and manage returns. The site also provides membership sign-up and renewal, a warehouse locator, and access to services such as pharmacy (prescription refills and transfers), optical and hearing centers, tire installation appointments, photo printing, business delivery, and travel deals via Costco Travel. Frequent member-only savings and online-only offers are featured throughout.

name: Allrecipes
description: Allrecipes is a community-driven recipe platform where users can discover, submit, and save recipes with step-by-step instructions, photos, and videos. It offers robust search and filtering by ingredients, cuisine, dietary needs, and cook time; detailed ratings, reviews, and user tips; nutrition information; and tools like a recipe box, collections, and printable formats. Users can generate shopping lists, follow personalized recommendations, explore meal-planning ideas, and engage with a large community sharing cooking advice and variations.

name: HBO Max
description: HBO Max is a subscription streaming service offering HBO originals, Warner Bros. movies and series, Max Originals, and curated hubs like DC, Cartoon Network, and Adult Swim. Users can browse and search the catalog, stream on web and supported apps, create multiple profiles (including kid profiles with parental controls), build watchlists, resume playback, enable subtitles and alternate audio, and download select titles for offline viewing. The site also supports account management, billing, device activation, and plans with ad-supported or ad-free options, including 4K HDR on compatible content and devices.

name: Charles Schwab
description: Charles Schwab’s website is an online brokerage, banking, and wealth management platform. Users can open and manage accounts; trade stocks, ETFs, options, mutual funds, and fixed income; and access real-time quotes, research, screeners, and market news. The site offers portfolio tracking and analysis, watchlists, planning tools for retirement (IRAs, rollovers), and automated investing via robo-advisor solutions. It also provides cash management features like checking, savings, transfers, and bill pay; secure document access (statements, tax forms); and education resources, webinars, and support. Trading is available through web and mobile interfaces, with advanced tools including thinkorswim.

name: OpenAI
description: OpenAI’s official site for its AI products and developer platform. Visitors can use ChatGPT on the web, explore models (e.g., GPT‑4o, o3, Sora), and find product pages, pricing, and updates. Developers can access API documentation, quickstarts, SDKs, the Playground for testing prompts, and a dashboard to manage API keys and usage. The site also hosts research and blog posts, safety and compliance information, enterprise solutions, case studies, and support resources.

name: CVS Pharmacy
description: CVS.com is the online hub for CVS Pharmacy and retail services. Users can refill and transfer prescriptions, set up auto-refill, track Rx status, and opt for home delivery or in-store pickup. The site lets customers schedule vaccinations and MinuteClinic appointments for basic health services. It also offers a full retail store for health, wellness, beauty, and household products with deals, digital coupons, weekly ads, same-day delivery, and curbside/in-store pickup. Additional features include a photo center for prints and gifts, ExtraCare rewards management, CarePass membership benefits, and account tools to manage family prescriptions, insurance, and payments.

name: Wayfair
description: Wayfair is an online marketplace for furniture, décor, and home improvement products. Users can search and filter millions of items by category, style, size, color, brand, and price, and view detailed product pages with specifications, dimensions, customer reviews, Q&A, and photos. The site provides curated room inspiration, frequent sales and clearance/open-box deals, delivery scheduling and order tracking, optional assembly/installation services, easy returns, and customer support. Additional features include wishlists and financing options at checkout; the mobile app offers AR View in Room to preview products at home.

name: Booking.com
description: Booking.com is a global online travel agency offering hotel bookings, flights, car rentals, and package vacations. Users can search and compare millions of properties worldwide, view real-time availability, read reviews, and book with flexible cancellation policies. The site supports multi-language and multi-currency, provides travel guides and recommendations, and offers special deals and loyalty programs. Bookings can be made directly through the site or via the mobile app, with secure payment options and customer support available in multiple languages.

name: OpenTable
description: OpenTable is a restaurant reservation platform where users search and filter restaurants by location, cuisine, price, rating, and availability, then pick a date, time, and party size to book a table. Users can manage reservations by modifying or canceling them, add special requests, view restaurant menus and photos, read and write reviews, and earn or use rewards points. Restaurants can manage their table inventory, view upcoming bookings, adjust seating configurations, and receive guest details and requests.

name: Slack
description: Slack is a team communication and collaboration platform organized around workspaces, channels, and direct messages. Users can send text messages, share files, react with emojis, create threads, start huddles and calls, and search across all conversations. Channels can be public or private, with granular permissions, and admins can manage members, integrations, and security settings. Apps and bots extend Slack with notifications, workflows, and automations such as approvals, alerts, and scheduled messages.

name: Steam
description: Steam is a digital distribution platform for PC games and software where users can browse, search, and filter titles by genre, tags, price, and reviews, then purchase, download, and launch them from their library. Users manage wishlists, trade items, join communities, post reviews, and participate in chat and friends lists. Developers and publishers can manage store pages, push updates, run discounts, and view analytics. The platform handles licensing, cloud saves, achievements, and in-game purchases.

name: Goodreads
description: Goodreads is a social cataloging site for books that lets users search for titles, authors, and genres, then add books to shelves like Read, Currently Reading, and Want to Read. Users can rate and review books, create custom shelves, track reading progress, and get personalized recommendations. They can join groups, participate in discussions, and create or join reading challenges. Authors can manage profiles, interact with readers, and promote their works.

name: Uber
description: Uber is a ride-hailing platform where users set pickup and dropoff locations, select ride types, view price estimates and ETA, and then request, track, and cancel rides. After trips, riders can rate drivers, leave feedback, and split fares. Drivers manage their availability, accept or decline requests, navigate routes, and view earnings. The platform handles fare calculation, payments, receipts, safety features, and support workflows like reporting issues or lost items.

name: Airbnb
description: Airbnb is a marketplace for short-term stays and experiences. Guests can search and filter listings by location, dates, price, property type, and amenities, then view detailed pages with photos, descriptions, house rules, and reviews. They submit booking requests or use instant book, manage trips, send messages to hosts, and handle cancellations or changes. Hosts can create and edit listings, set pricing and availability, manage calendars, respond to inquiries, and review guests. The platform manages payments, identity checks, and dispute resolution.

name: Trello
description: Trello is a visual project and task management tool based on boards, lists, and cards. Users create boards for projects, add lists to represent stages, and cards for tasks, which can be moved across lists to show progress. Cards support descriptions, checklists, attachments, labels, due dates, and assignees. Teams can comment, mention members, and subscribe to updates. Power-Ups and automations add features like custom fields, rules, integrations, and calendar views.

name: Stripe
description: Stripe is an online payments platform that enables businesses to accept and manage payments. Users can create customers, store payment methods, charge cards, set up subscriptions, issue refunds, and handle invoices and payouts. Dashboards show balances, payouts, disputes, and detailed transaction histories with filters and exports. Developers integrate Stripe via APIs and webhooks to support checkout flows, billing, and marketplace payouts, with configuration for tax, currencies, risk rules, and compliance.

name: Robinhood
description: Robinhood is a commission-free investing platform where users can search for stocks, ETFs, options, and cryptocurrencies, view quotes and charts, and place market or limit orders. Users manage watchlists, review portfolio performance, deposit or withdraw funds, and set up recurring investments. The app offers basic news, educational content, and alerts for price moves or corporate actions. Compliance features handle account verification, risk disclosures, and regulatory requirements.

name: Calendly
description: Calendly is an automated scheduling platform that lets users define event types with duration, locations (in-person or online), and availability rules, then share booking links. Invitees pick a time from free slots synced with connected calendars, automatically creating events and sending confirmations. Users can set buffers, limits per day, questions for invitees, and reminders, plus rescheduling and cancellation policies. Integrations connect to video conferencing, CRM, and payment tools.

name: Stack Overflow
description: Stack Overflow is a Q&A platform for developers where users ask programming questions, tag them by technology, and post code and explanations. Others can answer, comment, and edit content collaboratively. Voting, acceptance, and reputation systems surface high-quality answers and unlock privileges. Users can bookmark questions, follow tags, and search across the knowledge base. Teams and enterprises can create private spaces with dedicated moderation and analytics.

name: GitLab
description: GitLab is a DevOps platform centered on Git repositories, issues, and CI/CD pipelines. Users create projects, push code, manage branches, open merge requests, review diffs, and handle approvals. Issues and boards track work, with labels, milestones, and assignees. Built-in pipelines automate testing and deployment, and environments show deployment status. Permissions, groups, and project settings manage access, integrations, and security features like code scanning and approvals.

name: Uber Eats
description: Uber Eats is a food delivery platform that lets users browse restaurants, filter by cuisine, price, rating, or delivery time, and customize orders with menu options and special instructions. Users manage carts, apply promos, place orders, and track courier location in real time. They can modify or cancel orders within constraints, rate restaurants and couriers, and view past orders. Restaurants and couriers use their own dashboards/apps to manage menus, orders, and deliveries.

name: QuickBooks
description: QuickBooks is an accounting and bookkeeping platform for small businesses. Users can create and send invoices, track payments and expenses, categorize transactions, reconcile bank accounts, and manage customers and vendors. The system generates financial reports such as profit and loss, balance sheets, and cash flow. Payroll, tax, and inventory modules manage employees, filing, and stock. Multi-user access, roles, and audit trails support collaboration and compliance.

name: Jira
description: Jira is a project and issue tracking platform widely used for software development. Users create projects and configure workflows with states like To Do, In Progress, and Done, then create issues for tasks, bugs, or stories. Issues have fields such as assignee, priority, labels, sprints, and estimates, plus comments and attachments. Scrum and Kanban boards, backlogs, and reports help teams plan and track work. Admins manage schemes, permissions, integrations, and automation rules.

name: Google Calendar
description: Google Calendar is an online calendar and scheduling tool where users create events with titles, times, locations, guests, and video conferencing links. They can manage multiple calendars, share calendars with others, set notifications and reminders, and adjust visibility. Events support recurring rules, descriptions, attachments, and responses (RSVP). Users can search events, view by day/week/month, and integrate with other apps to auto-create meetings and reminders.

name: Ticketmaster
description: Ticketmaster is a ticketing platform for concerts, sports, and live events. Users search by artist, team, venue, or date, then choose events, select seats on a map or via price filters, and complete purchases. They can view and manage orders, download or add tickets to mobile wallets, transfer tickets, and in some cases resell them. Event organizers manage inventory, pricing, presales, and access controls. The system handles payments, delivery methods, and anti-fraud checks.

name: Instacart
description: Instacart is a grocery delivery and pickup service. Users select a store, browse categories or search for products, adjust quantities, and add items to a cart. At checkout, they choose delivery or pickup times, specify substitutions, and apply promo codes. During fulfillment, shoppers may message customers about replacements, and customers can track order progress and delivery in real time. Users can rate orders, tip shoppers, and view purchase history and receipts.

name: Patreon
description: Patreon is a membership platform that allows creators to offer subscription-based access to content and benefits. Creators set up pages with tiers, pricing, and rewards, then publish posts, audio, video, and other perks for patrons. Patrons can subscribe, manage memberships across creators, access exclusive content, comment, and message creators. The platform manages payments, billing cycles, and fraud checks, while creators can view analytics, payouts, and patron lists.

name: KAYAK
description: KAYAK is a travel search and booking aggregator that lets users search flights, hotels, and rental cars across multiple providers. Users can filter by price, times, airlines, stops, amenities, and ratings, then click through to complete bookings or book directly when available. Features include fare alerts, price tracking, trip planning, and itinerary management. The platform compares options, saves searches, and aggregates reservations into unified trip views.

name: Lyft
description: Lyft is a ride-hailing platform where users set pickup and dropoff locations, choose ride options, view pricing and ETAs, and request, track, or cancel rides. Riders can split fares, tip drivers, rate trips, and manage payment methods and preferences. Drivers manage availability, accept rides, navigate routes, and review earnings and incentives. Safety features include trip sharing, emergency options, and support flows for reporting issues.

name: Square
description: Square is a payments and point-of-sale platform for businesses. Merchants create catalogs of items with prices and taxes, accept in-person and online payments, issue refunds, and view transaction histories. They can manage customers, invoices, and recurring payments, as well as track sales, inventory, and basic analytics. Additional modules support online stores, appointments, and staff management. Admins configure deposits, fees, hardware, and security settings.

name: Grubhub
description: Grubhub is an online food ordering and delivery platform. Users search and filter restaurants by cuisine, price, rating, and delivery options, browse menus, customize items, and add them to carts. At checkout they choose delivery or pickup, schedule times, use promo codes, and pay. Orders can be tracked, and users can rate and review restaurants and drivers, manage addresses and payment methods, and view order history. Restaurants handle incoming orders and menus via their own dashboard or POS integrations.

name: Basecamp
description: Basecamp is a project management and team communication tool organized into projects, each containing to-dos, message boards, schedules, docs & files, and group chats. Users create tasks, assign them, set due dates, and track completion. Message boards host threaded discussions, while automatic check-ins and pings facilitate updates. Projects support file uploads, shared docs, and calendars. Admins manage teams, project access, and notifications across the workspace.

name: Salesforce
description: Salesforce is a cloud-based CRM platform where users manage leads, accounts, contacts, opportunities, and cases. Sales teams log activities, track deal stages, forecast revenue, and create tasks and events. Service teams handle support cases with queues, priorities, and SLAs. Dashboards and reports visualize KPIs, while automation tools like workflows and flows trigger actions based on rules. Admins configure objects, fields, layouts, permissions, and integrations with external systems.

name: ProtonMail
description: ProtonMail is a privacy-focused email service with end-to-end encryption. Users create mailboxes, send and receive emails, organize messages into folders and labels, and manage contacts. Security features include encrypted messages, optional password-protected emails to external recipients, two-factor authentication, and strict privacy controls. The interface supports search, filters, mail rules, and aliases, and users can adjust settings for signatures, auto-replies, and identity profiles.

name: Coinbase
description: Coinbase is a cryptocurrency exchange and wallet platform. Users verify identities, link payment methods, and buy, sell, and convert cryptocurrencies at market or recurring intervals. They can track portfolio balances and performance, view detailed transaction history, and transfer assets to and from external addresses. Watchlists and price alerts help monitor markets, while educational modules reward learning. Security settings include two-factor authentication, address whitelists, and withdrawal controls.
